item.title: System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster gets last minute delay for consoles
item.content:encoded:
Nightdive Studios has announced that it will be delaying the console release of System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster, and that it will not be released on June 26th. This impacts all console platforms including Xbox, Switch, and PlayStation. The PC version is unaffected by the delay and it will release on June 26th as planned.

In a statement, Nightdive Studios said, “We have encountered issues that have prevented us from launching System Shock 2: 25th Anniversary Remaster on consoles including Xbox, Switch, and PlayStation on June 26. We’re currently working to address these issues as quickly as possible. Because of this we’ve made the difficult decision to proceed with the game’s release on PC platforms (Steam, GOG, Epic, Humble) on June 26, with the console release now targeting the first two weeks of July. We’ll update everyone as soon as we have a set launch date for consoles.”

item.title: Painkiller has a release date of October 9th
item.content:encoded:
A release date has been given for Painkiller, the fast paced co-op shooter being developed by Anshar Studios and published by Saber Interactive’s 3D Realms label. Players will be able to get their hands on the game from October 9th, with Painkiller being released for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S. As well as announcing the release date, Saber Interactive has also confirmed that the game is available to pre-order, and detailed the different versions.

There are two versions of Painkiller available for pre-order including the standard version and the deluxe edition. The standard edition is priced at €39.99/£34.99 with a pre-order bonus of the Iron Crusade skin pack. This pack includes skins for all four of the game’s characters, who are Ink, Void, Sol, and Roch. The Iron Crusade pack also has skins for six of the game’s weapons, with those being the Electrodriver, Stakegun, Shotgun, SMG, Hand Cannon and Rocket Launcher. You can check out the weapons in action Painkiller’s last trailer that showcased them. The Painkiller Deluxe Edition is priced at €49.99/£44.99 will have the Iron Crusade pack, as well as three other post launch DLC packs that will each have six weapon skins and four character skins.

Painkiller’s story puts you in Purgatory where you have been given a chance to redeem yourself after transgressing against Heaven. The way to redeem yourself is by blasting away the demons of purgatory in an attempt to stop the fallen angel Azazel’s invasion of Earth.

Source: Press Release
